sections.purpose: To maintain samples at a constant temperature using heated water.
sections.scope: Applicable to incubation and reagent thawing in Microbiology.
procedure: Fill the bath with distilled water to the indicated level.
Set the desired temperature and switch ON the heater.
Allow the water to reach and stabilize at set temperature.
Place samples in racks or holders within the bath.
After use, switch OFF, allow water to cool, then drain and clean the bath.
Record any critical temperature-dependent runs in the logbook.
precautions: Do not operate the heater without sufficient water.
Avoid splashing water on control electronics.
Use distilled water to minimize scaling.
Periodically disinfect the bath to prevent microbial growth.
Ensure the bath is placed on a stable, level surface.
